Description: Annealed bronze axe-head: short and rather squat with markedly incurved sides, quite roughly finished. The two lugs are uneven in size and the cutting edge is lop-sided. The piece was once thickly corroded but has been completely cleaned. It is pitted all over, quite deeply in parts. Hammer marks are present on the sides and the cutting edge.
Curator's comments: Metallographic analysis has indicated that after casting the blade was quite heavily worked and then annealed, with a final cold working. A high hardness value was recorded for the cutting edge. Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Journal of Egyptian Archaeology' 10 (1924), 303.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (123)
